On today's episode: how one man tried to end noncompete contracts in his home state of Hawaii. And we update that story with news of a recent ruling from the Federal Trade Commission that could ban most noncompete agreements nationwide. Mahalo to our legislators Glenn Wakai , Chris Lee , Karl Rhoads,Senator Les Ihara Jr , and Derek Kawakami for making Hawaii an example for the nation.

My colleague Mike Gray sat down with Kathy Gosser, Ph.D., host of the FranchiseU! podcast, to discuss the recent ruling by the FTC banning non-compete contracts and the potential impact on franchises and employees. Employers with current and former California employees: the countdown is on to notification of "void" non-competes! Time to audit employee agreements (for any employee mobility language that might be considered a non-compete) and make sure your confidentiality agreements are strong.

New Episode Alert! Unchained: Unpacking the FTC Ban on Non-Competes In this episode of The Employment Strategists podcast, our hosts David Harmon and Mariya Gonor dive into the groundbreaking decision by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to ban most non-compete clauses. Currently, 30 million Americans are bound by non-competes, but with this new rule, significant changes are on the horizon for both employees and employers. David and Mariya will dissect what the rule entails, the necessary actions required from both sides, and strategic ways in which employers and employees can adapt to this new legal landscape. Join the conversation and stay informed! https://lnkd.in/e6HQmh8h #noncompete #FTC #themploymentstrategists
